title: Los Angeles/Downtown
name: The Bradbury Building
content: Built in 1893, the Bradbury Building is one of Southern California's most remarkable architectural achievements. Behind its modest exterior lies a light-filled Victorian court that rises 50 feet with open cage elevators, marble stairs and ornate iron railings. The building has been a set for many movies, including ''Blade Runner'' in 1982. Visitors without business in the building are allowed into the lobby and up to the first landing of the staircase.
